title: Cozy Beef Stew for Chilly Nights - Family Favorite
promptIMG: Professional food photography prompt: "beef stew, professionally plated in a rustic bowl, natural food photography, balanced sharp focus throughout entire image, zero blur, infinite depth of field, realistic food textures, modern kitchen background in sharp focus, natural window lighting, kitchen countertop visible, even focus distribution, documentary food photography style, professional food styling, appetizing presentation --no blur, depth of field, bokeh, over-sharpening, artificial enhancement --quality 2 --ar 4:3 --stylize 300"
description: Warm up with this cozy beef stew that’s ready in under an hour! Loaded with tender beef, hearty veggies, and aromatic herbs, it’s a dish that everyone loves it. Great for weeknight dinners or special gatherings. Save this recipe for your next family meal!
ingredients: 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef cubes and brown them on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Once browned, remove the beef and set it aside. In the same pot, add the onions and garlic, sautéing until they’re translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
Stir in the carrots and potatoes, cooking for another 5 minutes. Then, return the beef to the pot.
Pour in the beef broth and add the tomato paste, thyme, rosemary, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and let it simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the beef is tender.
Remove the bay leaf before serving. Enjoy your hearty stew!
tips: Here's the thing: Here are some tips to make your beef stew even better: - **Browning the meat:** Make sure to brown the beef well; it adds depth to the flavor. I usually do this in batches to avoid overcrowding the pot. - **Vegetable choices:** Feel free to add other veggies like peas or green beans for extra color and nutrition. Just toss them in during the last 10 minutes of cooking. - **Thickening the stew:** If you prefer a thicker stew, mix a tablespoon of cornstarch with cold water and stir it in during the last few minutes of cooking. - **Flavor boost:** I like to add a splash of red wine for richness. Just let it simmer a bit longer to cook off the alcohol. - **Storage:** This stew keeps well in the fridge for up to 3 days. Just reheat gently on the stove. It also freezes nicely for up to 3 months, so it’s great for meal prep! - **Personal touch:** I always use organic beef broth for a richer taste. Trust me, it makes a difference!
